Reviews.Title: Fits our needs perfectly.
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Morrison "TRM"
Reviews.Content: Great laptop at a great price...we shopped for several weeks comparing models and prices and believe this model to be a great buy.  Sams has a different model that came in second place in our comparison and it had a larger HDD but was last generation of processor and was about $75 less expensive.  We felt the newer processor was worth the additional cost and less HDD was not an issue with the price of external HDD being low.  Google differences in the processors and several reports will come up going to great lenghts why each generation is better than the last.The laptop itself is bigger than I had expected.  The texture of the outside is bumpy kinda of a faux carbon fiber look.  The laptop has a 10 key pad and is touch screen.  The screen is very responsive...almost too much!  Windows 8 is new for us and was a challenge getting started but after 15-20 minutes you can figure out just about everything you need.  Laptop connects wirelessly to our network blazingly fast...faster then iPads and phones we have.  Downloaded and installed the free 8.1 update with zero issues.  Picture is excellent and so far has excelled at online gaming, web surfing and email.We purchased for our youngest daughter to play school games, surf the web and play some online games she enjoys.  This laptop will easily meet her needs for several years to come.

Reviews.Title: Perfect size for the price
Reviews.Author: Misti Holland
Reviews.Content: I purchased this computer after doing a small amount of research, but the good review on this product sold me.  With that in mind here is my experience.  I had a Dell laptop for 7-8 years that worked great.  It had outlived it's life so I was looking to replace.  Since I had such great luck with my last Dell, it was only natural I would lean this direction.  I work on a Dell all day at work, but windows 8 was new to me.  I do, however, use an Iphone, so the transition was not difficult at all.  You can delete windows you don't want, pin websites to your windows, move your windows around in the order you want, just like your phone.  I found the adjustment rather easy. I hear from my programming buddies it is a whole different ball game, but if you are a point and click person , like me, you probably wont have any issues.  I was able to download my ITunes account and was playing music in minutes.  This laptop connects quickly to my wifi and I was able to play my FB games, pay bills, check my email, and shop Amazon with little to no learning curve.  I have only had this new laptop for about a week, but have used it for several hours a day each day with no problems at all.  I love the 10 key pad, as I am an accountant in my real life so it is perfect for me. The only thing I wish I had was the lighted keyboard, but if that is as bad as it gets, I would buy this laptop again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: Best bargain for the Year!!!
Reviews.Author: JesseBridgelal
Reviews.Content: Touchscreen, powerful processor, 6GB RAM....Windows 8.1!!.. sweet laptop for the price!! I wish I has bought more!! and Dell honours its warranty and offers warranty transfers too

Reviews.Title: My best laptop so far
Reviews.Author: manish
Reviews.Content: Good laptop with strong build quality and battety life. On time delivery. Migrated to windows 8.1 and touch is awesome. No issues so far and getting what i paid for with latest specs.

Reviews.Title: Solid, dependable machine
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: Good, solid dependable computer that appears to be solidly built. Keyboard, sounds, speed all good.  Screen resolution could be a lot crisper though.

Reviews.Title: Inspiron not what it used to be
Reviews.Author: thomas k shields
Reviews.Content: Well this is my second Inspiron, This one has Windows 8 and touchscreen, the touchscreen is ok.. One thing I hate about it is if you use the mouse pad, if you unconsciously drag your finger from either side of the mouse pad, it makes this side program (start, control panel, etc. ) come out from the right and lock the screen until you click away from it. If you come from the left it opens the app screen. Very frustrating. Also, I feel the i5 processor is slowwww! If I had to buy again, I would purchase something different.

Reviews.Title: Product is great
Reviews.Author: Helen Davis
Reviews.Content: Product is great but a little bigger than what I had anticipated. It is great for work using microsoft products

Reviews.Title: Very good computer
Reviews.Author: S. Kittle
Reviews.Content: Great laptop.  It feels a little cheap..I think that's mainly because of the light, streamlined design.  But overall not a by bad laptop. It's fast and the touchscreen display is cool, but I don't use it much because I don't like fingerprints on my screen.  Also I like the fact that there is a separate number pad - makes it easier to type numbers fast.  I had to adjust to Windows 8...I prefer the previous version of Windows.  I know I'm not alone in that preference.The size of the laptop is just right - big enough for watching movies but small enough to carry around.  Word of caution though - finding the program that plays the dvds is tough to locate. I did some research and found that that's because the new Windows took away Windows  media player (yet another reason why don't like Windows 8). I think the program that is installed is Cyberlink (or something like that).  I prefer Windows media player, but this isn't a bad program.  Overall I am happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: No regrets
Reviews.Author: Bernard
Reviews.Content: great product works well. no regrets as yet. will update as time goes by if there are any issues that come up.

Reviews.Title: Coffe Shop Happy
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Paige
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write a review that would fall under the most helpful category when it comes to researching and buying a new netbook.I'll start by saying I did a lot of research for this purchase and after deciding to buy it I paid to have the laptop to me in a day and it happened which is props to Amazon.I pulled it out of the box and the first thing I noticed was the black matte' case finish is a type of material that is going to collect a lot of fingerprints and smudges. I wash my hands regularly and have had the laptop 2 weeks now and have often had to wipe off the cover, the keys, and the space where your wrists sit. This is the only thing I can say is BAD about this machine. I do not like that the keys are not lit up for ease of use at night but the screen does provide good lighting and with a bit more focus it isn't a problem.Now to the GOOD. I was going to buy the version without the touchscreen feature and less memory and ram but thinking about the last Inspiron I used, I had no choice but to go with the upgrade because I was so pleased with my last Dell. I opened the netbook to reveal the sleek keyboard layout with a ten key attached to it and enough space to type comfortably. I recommend this for someone with longer fingers than average like me. I turned the laptop on and was so excited to get started after a long 2 hour download and install of 8.1. I began downloading new apps, getting used to the touchscreen, and even got my music and pictures moved over from other devices. The toughest learning curve to get over is using the touchscreen feature and navigating how the new 8.1 works. After a day or two of applied dinkin' around you should catch on to what you can do with the touchscreen and what you can do with the mouse comfortably. I will say touchscreen is the way to go because it's a neat feature worth the extra cost and the mouse clickers are slightly too loud on this model. I use my computer for daily tasks, research, and occasionally talking to family through Skype. The camera on this machine is nice for Skyping, as well as the microphone and audio too. If you're looking for great performance, good graphics, decent sound, and an everyday medium use machine. This one is a good buy. It can burn CDs and DVDs too which is something I haven't done in years. Worth 5 stars in performance but will give it 4 ultimately because I don't like smudges. Hahaha.

Reviews.Title: No support from Amazon
Reviews.Author: Rajkumar K.
Reviews.Content: I actually purchased this laptop from Amazon on 25th Nov 2013, after 2 months i have a display problem, it shows a mirrored display (negative display).  I already sent an query with amazon, but never bothered about this.If I had purchased from any other shop by direct, i can contact them to get it solution.  Now i am in helpless stand.

Reviews.Title: Dell
Reviews.Author: E. Peck "Bradens*Mommy"
Reviews.Content: We love it, it runs sort of slow sometimes but that could be our internet and not the computer. It serves its purposes and doesnt seem to run hot (like other Dell's I've had in the past). Overall good purchase and cant beat the lightening deals.

Reviews.Title: Nice laptop
Reviews.Author: Sudharsan
Reviews.Content: My first touch screen laptop. Windows 8 on this laptop is amazing. Nice to see apps on my laptop simillar to smart phones.In windows 8, i am unable to close the app which i have opened. So i always goes to taskmanager to kill it. It should be nice to see running apps in taskbar and closee option..

Reviews.Title: Not a good product, save your money or buy the warranty. You will need it.
Reviews.Author: Lori Roberg
Reviews.Content: Get the warranty. The back light screen always goes out. When contacting Dell they are rude and pretty much tell you TOO BAD, your warranty expired. You will lose all work you have on your hard drive. Do research over the internet and you will find out that other people have had the same experience.So sad someone who owns a company can screw all of their  customers. He is rich, we are not.Unfortunately I have to give a star to warn people about Dell. The company doesn't deserve it.

ProductInfo.Features:
Intel Core i5-4200U  Processor 1.6 GHz
6 GB DDR3
500 GB 5400 rpm Hard Drive
15.6-Inch Touchscreen Display
ProductInfo.Name: Dell Inspiron 15 i15RVT-13287BLK 15.6-Inch Touchscreen Laptop (Black)
